com.ebay.services.finding

Class GetSearchKeywordsRecommendationRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ebay.services.finding.BaseServiceRequest
      • com.ebay.services.finding.GetSearchKeywordsRecommendationRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GetSearchKeywordsRecommendationRequest
extends BaseServiceRequest
implements java.io.Serializable
    Checks specified keywords for spelling errors and returns corrected keywords that will provide better search results. If you make a keyword query search that returns no results, use this call to check the keywords for misspellings. The call checks the words in context of the entire query. For example, if you submit "arry potter" in the request, the response will recommend "harry potter." However, if you submit "potter arry" in the request, the response will recommend "potter army."

    The response will not return recommended keywords in the following conditions:
    • Keywords value returns results (even a single item) in either findItemsByKeywords or findItemsAdvanced.
    • Keywords value contains no misspelled words (even if the keywords query returns no items).

    Java class for GetSearchKeywordsRecommendationRequest complex type.

    The following schema fragment specifies the expected content contained within this class. 

     <complexType name="GetSearchKeywordsRecommendationRequest">
   <complexContent>
     <extension base="{http://www.ebay.com/marketplace/search/v1/services}BaseServiceRequest">
       <sequence>
         <element name="keywords" type="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}string"/>
       </sequence>
     </extension>
   </complexContent>
 </complexType>
